  16. #ifndef CAML_BACKTRACE_H
  17. ‌#define CAML_BACKTRACE_H

  19. #include "mlvalues.h"

  21. /* [caml_record_backtraces] controls backtrace recording.
  22. * This function can be called at runtime by user-code, or during
  23. * initialization if backtraces were requested.
  24. *
  25. * It might be called before GC initialization, so it shouldn't do OCaml
  26. * allocation.
  27. */
  28. CAMLextern void caml_record_backtraces(int);

  30. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  32. #include "exec.h"

  34. /* Runtime support for backtrace generation.
  35. *
  36. * It has two kind of users:
  37. * - high-level API to capture and decode backtraces;
  38. * - low-level runtime routines, to introspect machine state and determine
  39. *   whether a backtrace should be generated when using "raise".
  40. *
  41. * Backtrace generation is split in multiple steps.
  42. * The lowest-level one, done by [backtrace_byt.c] and
  43. * [backtrace_nat.c] just fills the [Caml_state->backtrace_buffer]
  44. * variable each time a frame is unwinded.
  45. * At that point, we don't know whether the backtrace will be useful or not so
  46. * this code should be as fast as possible.
  47. *
  48. * If the backtrace happens to be useful, later passes will read
  49. * [Caml_state->backtrace_buffer] and turn it into a [raw_backtrace] and then a
  50. * [backtrace].
  51. * This is done in [backtrace.c] and [stdlib/printexc.ml].
  52. *
  53. * Content of buffers
  54. * ------------------
  55. *
  56. * [Caml_state->backtrace_buffer] (really cheap)
  57. *   Backend and process image dependent, abstracted by C-type backtrace_slot.
  58. * [raw_backtrace] (cheap)
  59. *   OCaml values of abstract type [Printexc.raw_backtrace_slot],
  60. *   still backend and process image dependent (unsafe to marshal).
  61. * [backtrace] (more expensive)
  62. *   OCaml values of algebraic data-type [Printexc.backtrace_slot]
  63. */
  64. /* [Caml_state->backtrace_active] is non zero iff backtraces are recorded.
  65. * This variable must be changed with [caml_record_backtrace] in OCaml or
  66. * [caml_record_backtraces] in C.
  67. */
  68. ‌#define caml_backtrace_active (Caml_state_field(backtrace_active))
  69. /* The [Caml_state->backtrace_buffer] and [Caml_state->backtrace_last_exn]
  70. * variables are valid only if [Caml_state->backtrace_active != 0].
  71. *
  72. * They are part of the state specific to each thread, and threading libraries
  73. * are responsible for copying them on context switch.
  74. * See [otherlibs/systhreads/st_stubs.c].
  75. *
  76. *
  77. * [Caml_state->backtrace_buffer] is filled by runtime when unwinding stack. It
  78. * is an array ranging from [0] to [Caml_state->backtrace_pos - 1].
  79. * [Caml_state->backtrace_pos] is always zero if
  80. * [!Caml_state->backtrace_active].
  81. *
  82. * Its maximum size is determined by [BACKTRACE_BUFFER_SIZE] from
  83. * [backtrace_prim.h], but this shouldn't affect users.
  84. */
  85. ‌#define caml_backtrace_buffer (Caml_state_field(backtrace_buffer))
  86. ‌#define caml_backtrace_pos (Caml_state_field(backtrace_pos))

  88. /* [Caml_state->backtrace_last_exn] stores the last exception value that was
  89. * raised, iff [Caml_state->backtrace_active != 0]. It is tested for equality
  90. * to determine whether a raise is a re-raise of the same exception.
  91. */
  92. ‌#define caml_backtrace_last_exn (Caml_state_field(backtrace_last_exn))

  94. /* FIXME: this shouldn't matter anymore. Since OCaml 4.02, non-parameterized
  95. * exceptions are constant, so physical equality is no longer appropriate.
  96. * raise and re-raise are distinguished by:
  97. * - passing reraise = 1 to [caml_stash_backtrace] (see below) in the bytecode
  98. *   interpreter;
  99. * - directly resetting [Caml_state->backtrace_pos] to 0 in native runtimes for
  100. *   raise.
  101. */


  104. #ifndef NATIVE_CODE

  106. /* Path to the file containing debug information, if any, or NULL. */
  107. ‌CAMLextern char_os * caml_cds_file;

  109. /* Primitive called _only_ by runtime to record unwinded frames to
  110. * backtrace.  A similar primitive exists for native code, but with a
  111. * different prototype. */
  112. extern void caml_stash_backtrace(value exn, value * sp, int reraise);

  114. CAMLextern void caml_load_main_debug_info(void);
  115. #endif


  118. /* Default (C-level) printer for backtraces.  It is called if an
  119. * exception causes a termination of the program or of a thread.
  120. *
  121. * [Printexc] provide a higher-level printer mimicking its output but making
  122. * use of registered exception printers, and is used when possible in place of
  123. * this function after [Printexc] initialization.
  124. */
  125. CAMLextern void caml_print_exception_backtrace(void);

  127. void caml_init_backtrace(void);
  128. CAMLextern void caml_init_debug_info(void);

  130. #endif /* CAML_INTERNALS */

  132. #endif /* CAML_BACKTRACE_H */
